hero.title:
Where Ancestors
Live Forever
hero.subtitle: Discover the sacred highlands of Tana Toraja, a land where life and death are celebrated in equal measure.

promo.title: Magical Toraja
promo.subtitle: Experience the unique culture and breathtaking landscapes of Tana Toraja.

hero.title: Living Heritage
hero.subtitle: A timeless journey into the sacred traditions of Tana Toraja.

intro.title: Aluk Todolo
intro.subtitle: The Way of the Ancestors
intro.description: In Toraja, death is not an end, but a transition. Our entire life is a preparation for the journey to Puya (the afterlife). This profound connection with our ancestors shapes every aspect of our daily existence, from the architecture of our homes to the patterns in our textiles.
intro.quote: To live well is to honor those who came before us.

rambuSolo.title: Rambu Solo'
rambuSolo.description: The elaborate funeral ceremony that is the centerpiece of Toraja social life.

tongkonan.title: Tongkonan
tongkonan.description: More than a house, it is the spiritual center of the family clan.

tauTau.title: Tau-Tau
tauTau.description: Wooden effigies that serve as earthly vessels for the spirits of the dead.

tenun.title: Tenun Toraja
tenun.description: Woven fabrics that tell stories of lineage, social status, and spirituality.

londa.title: Londa
londa.description: Ancient burial caves hanging from limestone cliffs, guarding the secrets of the ancestors.

passiliran.title: Passiliran
passiliran.description: Sacred baby graves in living trees, returning pure souls to nature to grow with the tree.

items.title: The Buffalo's Worth
items.text: Albino buffaloes (Tedong Bonga) can cost over $50,000 USD and are considered sacred vehicles for the afterlife.

items.title: Cliff Graves
items.text: Bodies are buried in stone cliffs to save land for agriculture and to protect the remains from animals.

items.title: Royal Colors
items.text: The four main colours of Toraja carvings (black, red, yellow, white) represent the social caste and metaphysics.
